titleInfo.title: USA v. Balquier
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 8 Motion to Withdraw as Attorney as to Mario Balquier Jr. Mary C. Gryva shall be deemed withdrawn as attorney of record and shall forthwith provide Carlos A. Monzon with the discovery materials provided the defendant by the government and such other materials obtained by Ms. Gryva which are material to the defendant's defense. Signed by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett on 7/14/2006. (MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting 8 Motion to Withdraw as Attorney as to Mario Balquier Jr. Mary C. Gryva shall be deemed withdrawn as attorney of record and shall forthwith provide Carlos A. Monzon with the discovery materials provided the defendant by the government and such other materials obtained by Ms. Gryva which are material to the defendant's defense. Signed by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett on 7/14/2006. (MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Balquier
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding 17 Motion for Release as to Mario Balquier Jr. The motion is set for hearing on September 14, 2006 at 10:00 a.m. before Magistrate Judge F.A. Gossett. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER regarding 17 Motion for Release as to Mario Balquier Jr. The motion is set for hearing on September 14, 2006 at 10:00 a.m. before Magistrate Judge F.A. Gossett. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (MLF, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Balquier
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 21 Motion to Continue trial as to Mario Balquier Jr. (1); trial of this matter is rescheduled for October 30, 2006; the additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, i.e., the time between September 6, 2006 and October 30, 2006, shall be deemed excludable time under the Speedy Trial Act. Jury Trial set for 10/30/2006 at 09:00 AM before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken.(PCV, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting 21 Motion to Continue trial as to Mario Balquier Jr. (1); trial of this matter is rescheduled for October 30, 2006; the additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, i.e., the time between September 6, 2006 and October 30, 2006, shall be deemed excludable time under the Speedy Trial Act. Jury Trial set for 10/30/2006 at 09:00 AM before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken.(PCV, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Balquier
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - IT IS ORDERED that the un-opposed Motion to Continue the detention hearing 25 is granted. Defendant's detention hearing is rescheduled to 10/13/06 at 1:30pm, before the undersigned in Courtroom No. 3(Omaha) as to defendant Mario Balquier Jr. Detention Hearing set for 10/13/2006 01:30 PM in Courtroom 3 (Omaha) before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (KBJ)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - IT IS ORDERED that the un-opposed Motion to Continue the detention hearing 25 is granted. Defendant's detention hearing is rescheduled to 10/13/06 at 1:30pm, before the undersigned in Courtroom No. 3(Omaha) as to defendant Mario Balquier Jr. Detention Hearing set for 10/13/2006 01:30 PM in Courtroom 3 (Omaha) before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Balquier
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Mario Balquier, Jr. (1), Count 1 - The Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only; Count 1s - DEFENDANT pleaded guilty to count I of the Information and is committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of twenty-seven (27) months; 1 year supervised release with special conditions; $100.00 special assessment as to defendant Mario Balquier, Jr. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons on or after April 3, 2007. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (4 certified copies given to US Marshal)(ADB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Mario Balquier, Jr. (1), Count 1 - The Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only; Count 1s - DEFENDANT pleaded guilty to count I of the Information and is committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of twenty-seven (27) months; 1 year supervised release with special conditions; $100.00 special assessment as to defendant Mario Balquier, Jr. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons on or after April 3, 2007. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (4 certified copies given to US Marshal)(ADB)
